title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Antiochus's palace, Antioch, Syria
scene_summary: Pericles, seeking Antiochus's daughter, must solve a riddle to win her or die. He deciphers it, revealing Antiochus's incest, but diplomatically conceals his knowledge. Antiochus, suspecting Pericles knows, delays the marriage and plots his death. Pericles, warned by the riddle's danger, flees, establishing his perilous journey.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Pericles's palace, Tyre
scene_summary: Pericles, back in Tyre, fears Antiochus's pursuit and confides in Helicanus, his loyal advisor. Helicanus urges him to travel abroad to avoid danger. Pericles sails to Tarsus, delegating rule to Helicanus, showing his caution and setting up his wanderings.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Cleon's palace, Tarsus
scene_summary: Thaliard, Antiochus's assassin, arrives in Tyre but learns Pericles has fled. Meanwhile, in Tarsus, Cleon, the governor, and his wife, Dionyza, lament their city's famine. A messenger announces Pericles's arrival with aid, briefly noting Thaliard's failed mission, transitioning to Pericles's generosity.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Cleon's palace, Tarsus
scene_summary: Cleon and Dionyza welcome Pericles, who brings grain to relieve Tarsus's famine. Grateful, they host him, but Pericles, restless, plans to travel again, fearing Antiochus. The scene establishes Pericles's heroism and the pattern of his sea-bound adventures.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A shore near Pentapolis
scene_summary: Pericles, shipwrecked, is rescued by fishermen who mock courtly life. They give him a rusty armor from their nets, and Pericles resolves to join a tournament at Simonides's court to win honor, showing his resilience and humility.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A hall in Simonides's palace, Pentapolis
scene_summary: Simonides and his daughter, Thaisa, watch knights, including Pericles, present their shields in a tournament. Pericles, in poor armor, wins, impressing Thaisa, who favors him. Simonides honors him, sparking their mutual attraction, advancing the romantic subplot.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A banqueting hall in Simonides's palace, Pentapolis
scene_summary: At a feast, Pericles, modest, converses with Thaisa, who admires him. Simonides tests Pericles's humility, noting Thaisa's affection. The court dances, and Pericles's grace wins favor, deepening the romance and his rise in Pentapolis.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Cleon's palace, Tarsus
scene_summary: Helicanus informs Escanes in Tyre of Antiochus's death. Two lords urge Helicanus to rule, but he remains loyal to Pericles, refusing the crown. The brief scene ensures Tyre's stability and removes the Antioch threat, focusing on Pericles's journey.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Simonides's palace, Pentapolis
scene_summary: Simonides, feigning anger, shows Pericles a letter from Thaisa confessing her love, testing him. Pericles admits his feelings, and Simonides approves their marriage, revealing his ruse. They wed, and Thaisa is soon pregnant, concluding the Pentapolis arc with joy.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: On a ship at sea
scene_summary: During a storm, Thaisa gives birth to Marina but appears to die. Pericles, grieving, names the child Marina. Sailors insist Thaisa's body be thrown overboard to calm the storm, and Pericles complies, placing her in a chest. He redirects to Tarsus, marking the tragic turn.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Cerimon's house, Ephesus
scene_summary: Cerimon, a physician, revives Thaisa, found in the chest, using his skill. Thaisa, believing Pericles dead, resolves to join a temple of Diana, becoming a votaress. Cerimon's kindness saves her, introducing a hopeful twist to the separation.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Cleon's palace, Tarsus
scene_summary: Pericles entrusts Marina to Cleon and Dionyza in Tarsus, too grieved to raise her. He vows not to cut his hair until Marina weds and sails for Tyre. Cleon promises to care for Marina, setting up her upbringing and Pericles's withdrawal.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A temple in Ephesus
scene_summary: Thaisa, in Diana's temple, commits to a chaste life, believing her family lost. The brief scene confirms her survival and spiritual retreat, paralleling Pericles's grief and foreshadowing their reunion.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A shore near Tarsus
scene_summary: Dionyza orders Leonine to kill Marina, but Marina pleads for mercy. Pirates interrupt, kidnapping Marina to sell in Mytilene. Leonine lies to Dionyza, claiming Marina dead, escalating her danger but sparing her life through chance.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A brothel in Mytilene
scene_summary: Pander, Boult, and Bawd buy Marina for their brothel, but her virtue resists corruption. She persuades clients to reform, frustrating the bawds. Boult agrees to find her honest work, highlighting Marina's purity amidst degradation.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A room in Cleon's palace, Tarsus
scene_summary: Cleon learns of Marina's “death” and Dionyza's plot, condemning her but agreeing to lie to Pericles. They erect a monument for Marina, deceiving Pericles, who, grief-stricken, withdraws further, underscoring Dionyza's villainy and Pericles's loss.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: The stage (Chorus narration)
scene_summary: Gower describes Pericles, mourning Marina, sailing aimlessly. Diana appears in a vision, directing him to her temple in Ephesus. Pericles heads there, setting up the reunion, with Gower urging the audience to imagine the journey's end.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: A street in Mytilene
scene_summary: Two gentlemen, reformed by Marina's virtue, praise her influence outside the brothel. The brief scene reinforces Marina's moral power, contrasting the brothel's corruption and preparing for her rescue.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: The brothel in Mytilene
scene_summary: Lysimachus, Mytilene's governor, visits the brothel but is swayed by Marina's purity to protect her. He offers her honorable work, and Boult, moved, agrees to help. Marina's virtue triumphs, securing her safety and setting up her meeting with Pericles.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: On Pericles's ship off Mytilene
scene_summary: Lysimachus visits Pericles, catatonic with grief, and brings Marina to cheer him. Marina sings, and her story reveals she's his daughter. They reunite joyfully, and Pericles learns of Lysimachus's suit to Marina. Diana's vision urges him to Ephesus, uniting father and daughter and promising further restoration.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: The stage (Chorus narration)
scene_summary: Gower briefly describes Pericles's journey to Ephesus, where he'll reunite with Thaisa. He sets up the final scene, emphasizing the family's restoration through divine guidance, transitioning to the climax.

title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
location: The stage (Chorus narration)
scene_summary: Gower concludes, summarizing Pericles's restoration, Cleon and Dionyza's punishment, and the moral of virtue's reward. He bids farewell, reinforcing the play's themes of endurance and providence, closing the episodic tale.
